page.title: 05STOCKPORT BUS STATION
page.content:
Built in 1982, it is the 2nd largest in Gtr. Manchester and serves an area covering local Stockport districts to Bolton, 20 miles to the North East.
In the bus station there are 6 bays where buses can come in and depart. The rows of bus shelters are lettered from A-Z which makes it easier for people to find the service they want. A control tower and information office are located near the A6. At the bus station there are 184 buses, 600 drivers and 12 inspectors as well as office and garage workers.
Under the viaduct are 2 garages where they wash and repair the buses as well as refilling them with diesel,changing their tyres and housing them for the night.
